intro: Codonopsis deltoidea, commonly known as the delta bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its tubular flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Codonopsis deltoidea is valued in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
